intro: Menziesia purpurea, commonly known as purple menziesia, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and blueberries, and is characterized by its preference for acidic, well-drained soils. The plant features small, oval leaves that turn red in the fall, adding visual interest to the landscape. Its showy, bell-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple, blooming in early spring. Menziesia purpurea is often found in moist, wooded areas and can serve as an ornamental plant in gardens.
